intro: Codonoboea johorica, commonly known as the Johor codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a glossy surface, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
